Reviews.Title: Solid Laptop, Great Performance, Not a Gaming Machine
Reviews.Author: D. Pool
Reviews.Content: When I needed a computer for school I was a little apprehensive. I thought I would buy a Chromebook for the cost however I am very pleased i went in for a little more power.First off the big thing on this machine that will get some looks is the hard drive. It only has 126GB. For a laptop in today's world that is a little light--however it is not a gaming laptop that needs tons of memory.What this is however is the meanest little web surfer and office utility computer I have ever had. With 16GB of RAM you would be hard pressed to confuse or slow down this computer with normal use. Also it is solid state so my battery life, shut down/start up, and install speeds are all phenomenal.And that said, I use Blender for 3D modeling and it runs it like a champ. I am actually going to start using this over my 'gaming rig' for my game development projects.It is very thin, light, and sturdy. I don't trust carrying it around too much without a slip case. I should have bought one when I got it but alwell. It is deceivingly tough though for how small it is.Other great things about this laptop is the keyboard. Lots of laptops have pretty small keyboards. Having large hands this presents a problem typing out long grad school papers. Not the HP ProBook, it has a great full size board, spaced out keys, and it has a lovely action to the keys. I wouldn't say it is mechanical-ish but you feel a satisfying bounce to each stroke without any annoying clapping of clicking.The display does seem a little dim. You can make it out in full sunlight but it isn't super impressive. However the resolution is amazing. The first thing I did, while downloading Steam, was to watch Netflix. It has a crystal clear display.One bad thing (I guess) is that it does come with HP's programs that are hard coded to the recovery disk. So if you are a purist you may have to blow away the OS and start over. I am flaky about choosing a Anti-Virus though so I don't mind HP coming with some built in.Other cool features: you can unlock it with your finger, you can connect your phone to it through bluetooth, you can (supposedly but not fully tested) work with a smart TV through it, and the keyboard is spill resistant!Soooo---I might be a little too excited for this laptop but I think it is worth the money and really doesn't have any huge issues that I have hit. My laptop did have a defective key (bent keyboard spring) but I was able to get a replacement very quickly at no charge that works great.

Reviews.Title: fast and light
Reviews.Author: Laura Thulesen
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this computer.  I have been using a laptop significantly heavier and without the solid state drive.  This one runs faster and cooler and I love the difference in weight.  This is an expensive computer but I loved the choices on big RAM and the SS drive.  It's not a big hard drive, which makes me not love it (I have lots and lots of music and pictures I like to keep on my HD all the time, as well as big files).  Also, the other reason I didn't mark "love it" is because it has an issue that if you pick it up on the left bottom while its in use and squeeze it (which you do when transporting it to another room), I have twice had the screen go to static and buzz.  It has to be forced to restart but then seems fine upon startup.  Great computer overall!

Reviews.Title: Good Solid Laptop - Value for money
Reviews.Author: AD
Reviews.Content: Awesome Laptop. Could use a better display. very light. Ultrabook like but with a swappable battery. I got the 16 GB one with SSD and it is wicked fast. HP security SW is annoying. Disable it. Rarely heats up.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: beancounterkevin
Reviews.Content: I wasn't looking for a real fast computer but I wanted a solid state hard drive so it would boot up fast.  This computer is exactly what I wanted - light, relatively inexpensive, and looks like a basic laptop.  Suits my needs well.

Reviews.Title: Fast and awesome laptop
Reviews.Author: Derek Djeu
Reviews.Content: This HP Pro Book is fast and light! It looks sleek. The only thing to keep in mind is that you may want to uninstall some of the HP software when you receive the laptop so that it doesn't drag the performance. I've used Lenovo and Acer in the past, and this HP laptop is far faster and sleeker. Just what I was looking for, five stars for HP.

Reviews.Title: Light and fast
Reviews.Author: mcmanuspop "Bobby D"
Reviews.Content: I was initially worried the i3 4010u processor would be slow. I  was wrong, and it probably doesnt use much battery juice. Laptop runs cool on lap. So far very pleased

Reviews.Title: Great HP Ultrabook for video.
Reviews.Author: David C. Crenshaw
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice product. Fast and lightweight. Places videos very well in 1080. My wife loves it. It replaced an older laptop.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop
Reviews.Author: Tony Sherman
Reviews.Content: Ruined by bloat ware and HP nagware. Nothing Stella but a reasonable laptop, every time I buy HP I hope it is going to be different, but then the narcissistic  nanny state that is HP bloat ware takes over.Ho hum

Reviews.Title: There are missing Items
Reviews.Author: Hans J Waschewsky
Reviews.Content: I am still working on figuring out where to find things. For being a NEW laptop, there is no installation manual.  There is a label for an HD Webcam, but no Webcam. Please send me at least those items.Hans J Waschewsky.
